definition[0]: to write a report, article etc using notes that you made earlier
example[0]: I have to write up my report before the meeting.
definition[1]: to write something on a wall, board etc where people can see it
example[1]: The teacher repeated the word, and then wrote it up on the blackboard.
definition[2]: if something is written up in a newspaper, magazine etc, someone describes what it is like and gives their opinion of it
example[2]: We’re going to a Spanish restaurant that was written up in Time Out’s good food guide.
definition[3]: a written opinion about a new book, play, or product in a newspaper, magazine etc
example[3]: The play got a really good write-up  (=it was praised) in the press.
definition[4]: to increase the value of an asset, usually land or a building, as shown in a company’s accounts
example[4]: The company can periodically write up the value of certain assets if its directors think the assets are worth more than the purchase price.
definition[5]: when the value of an asset is increased
example[5]: The company had expected a total asset write-up of about A$1 billion.
definition[6]: a written opinion about a new product, book etc
example[6]: Their PC had a good write-up but the purchase price had increased by £50.
